description: Accruals calculated from the cash flow. A higher value may indicate some suspicious moves.
Score from the Benford fraud detection model which is based on the digit distributions of the accounting numbers.
Fscore is an indicator for company misconduct. It includes accruals, financial performance, market incentives, and off-balance sheet values. It is estimated for a longer period.
The field estimates the discretionary accruals which are subject to management's autonomy. It is based on the Jones model and it assumes that the revenues are unmanaged.
The field is a modification of the Jones model where the score also takes into account that discretion can be exercised over revenues.
Mscore aims to investigate sudden growth, deteriorating fundamentals, or unexpected values in accounting. A shorter-term indicator than Fscore.
The field is the ratio of net accruals and the total accruals.
The field investigates the number of accounting updates and corrections. It can predict underperforming stocks.
Score is the equal weighted average of the different accounting models
Accruals calculated from the working capital.
Yoon working capital accruals focuses on the changes in cash, depreciation expenses, and amortization. Another version of the Jones model.
